section.para: Locales are associated with users and define the format for date, time, decimal precision, and color that the user sees on the screen. Part of defining a Locale is setting the language and the Country. It is the combination of language and Country that determines the format for the date and how decimals and periods are displayed. For example, a Locale that references English and the United States will display as follows:
A Locale that refers to German and Germany will display like this:

When a Language is selected and the Country is left as "Default," the xTuple client expects to find the file xTuple.xx.qm (where xx is the ISO two letter language code) located in the directory where the xTuple client is located. You can find these codes in xTuple by navigating to System > Master Information > Countries and observing the abbreviation column. The .QM file contains the translation information xTuple requires to display the user interface in a different language. Please contact xTuple for more information about the availability of .QM files for various languages.

Alternately, when a Language is selected and the Country is also selected, the xTuple client expects to find the file xTuple.xx_yy.qm located in the directory where the xTuple client is installed. The xx is the ISO two letter language code and yy is the two letter country code. If it does not find a file that matches the Language and Country (xTuple.xx_yy.qm) it next looks for a file that contains the Language only (e.g., xTuple.xx.qm). The U.S. federal government makes the list of languages available on its language codes website.

If no .QM translaction file is found, the xTuple client will report the error and continue the logon. The user will be presented the screens in the default language, which is English. The conventions established for the Locale that define date, time, decimal precision, and color will be presented based on the Locale associated with the User.

The "Locales" screen displays information on all existing Locales, including Locale name and Locale description.
To the far right of the screen, the following buttons are available:
